summary: This bill, the "Establishing Responsibility for Illegals’ Crimes and Adding Deterrence and Accountability for Mayors’ Sanctuary Cities Act of 2025" (ERIC ADAMS Act of 2025), criminalizes mayors of sanctuary cities if an undocumented immigrant commits murder within their jurisdiction. It establishes criminal negligence resulting in manslaughter if the mayor maintained a sanctuary policy that restricted cooperation with federal immigration enforcement and contributed to the crime. Penalties include imprisonment, fines, and removal from office. The bill defines "sanctuary city," "undocumented immigrant," and "mayor," grants the Attorney General exclusive prosecution authority and sets a 90-day effective date.
